title: Lost letters from Captain Scott reveal bitter rivalry with Shackleton
text:
There’s some irony in getting lost on the way to a map exhibition. But that’s what happened yesterday, when Google Maps got rather confused at where exactly the new Stanfords Exhibition is.

When I finally found 10 Langley Street, or more accurately, when Vivien Godfrey emerged to find me, she welcomed me in – sympathetic to my loss of bearings. The building has 16 written on the door, for a start. We get straight into map chat.

“What you’re looking at on your phone isn’t a map. It’s an aid to navigation,” she said, before leading my eye to an 1859 map of pre-unification Italy hanging on the wall – microscopic in detail. “A proper map, like this, gives you the context of where you are in the world.”
